nodes.text: Galaxy of Fear: Clones is the eleventh book in the young readers Star Wars: Galaxy of Fear series.
In the Ruins of an abandoned Jedi Fortress on the remote planet Dantooine, Tash Arranda stands, all alone. At least, she thinks she's alone. She senses something in the ruins — Something Dark.

The darkness is stronger than Tash, and Against her will, she reaches out to it. It makes her feel powerful. And it frightens her. Tash doesn't know that this is only the beginning of a terrifying journey into an evil world, where she'll be forced to fight her own brother and uncle .... to the death!

* Cloning is first indicated when Tash sees the same person walk by twice.
* The book is especially notable for the fight between Darth Vader and his clearly insane clone.
* The book also alerts readers to the goings on in wild space, on two separate but varied worlds called Weik and Odessen.
Something strange is going on in the old Jedi ruins. Something dark and evil... and Tash Arranda senses the Dark side of the force within the ruins.
